reviews.review_msg: Dr. Perkins is extremely helpful if you actually make the effort to ask her for help. Office hours exist for a reason, and I found them extremely helpful in completing this course and making sure I was on track. She is a difficult marker, this is a W course, meaning your writing skills matter. Pay attention, edit your work, and go to office hours.
I took this course with her, but graded by TA. she was a nice person

Quite possibly the toughest grader there is. She seems like a rude person in general. Avoid taking this class with her if you can. Lectures are boring. She doesn't provide the slides so you have to actually attend her lectures. Stay away!

Lectures were boring and not needed to do well in the class since you were only graded on papers. Participation in tutorial was worth 30% and you have to basically answer every discussion question to get full marks. The papers had clear grading criteria but were required to be much longer than what should have been necessary to explain your point.

I'm currently sitting at a B- going into the final. This course is one of the more difficult criminology courses, but with the right prof you can get the grade you desire. I felt she was a very tough grader for papers. I have taken Alexandra Lysova before, and she is much better in person. The course really hasn't adapted to online.

Dr. Lysova is such a warm and engaging professor, she made a lot of connections to real-life contexts that made an otherwise theoretically dense class interesting and memorable. She is easy to reach via e-mail and is understanding and approachable, I can't recommend her enough. The final is quite intimidating, however, so do be prepared for that.

Alexandra is a good professor. I never went to lecture since she posts all her slides online and managed to be fine. This a W course so get ready to write; however, the papers were marked fairly. Don't buy the textbook you do not really need it (I barely used it this semester). Overall, good professor.
Logan was unhelpful and inaccessible outside of class. Unclear guidelines and marking style.

Tamie is a professor who genuinely care for her students. She is as invested in the course material and in your success as you are. Her TA's are amazing and her assignments are designed to help you grow in the course. The classes were remote (Summer 2020) but I thoroughly enjoyed them. Will 100% recommend and will 1000% take a class with her again!

Lots of writing but the prof was great. She cares about her students and their learning and spent a lot of time with me during office hours working on my ideas. Quick to respond to emails and supported to my needs and personal issues and seemed aware of the classes vibes and needs too. Tough but I learnt a lot and it didn't make me bleed.

My fav prof at SFU and 2nd class with her; she is genuine, kind and you can tell she loves it. EX: cares about her students enough to stay until 11 one nite after class meeting with all of us about our proposals. The class has lots of writing & theory. Not an easy  A but I recommend taking it with Sarah. Tough class but great prof.

Yercich treats this like a university class. Makes us work, but lectures and assignments are interesting. Super interesting lecture and makes theory easy to understand with real life examples from her precious jobs etc. Really enjoyed this class. Felt like the first real unversity class I've taken. Would recommend.

Interesting lectures. Makes a boring subject tolerable. Really interesting real life examples and cool life experience. Straight forward and fair grader. Final was easy. Told us ahead of time what topics were "fair game" and those were exactly what were on the final. Said it wouldn't be comprehensive and stuck to her word. Reasonable and fair.

Sarah is a good lecturer. Theories aren't very exciting, but she did a good job keeping it relatively interesting. She was very quick to reply to emails and very helpful. My only criticisms are that her guidelines were way too restrictive and the tutorials felt like glorified grammar classes that touched on theory here and there.
would recommend
Would recommend; she's nice & good. Meets with students & helps. Knows theory and teaches it good.
Horrible TA.
good and helpful. makes a boring topic interesting with examples from her work and research. would recommend
Abby is wonderful. Super knowledgeable and helpful and super hot!
would recommend
Funny as hell. Makes it make sense with real life examples. Tough marker but fair. There for U when U need help. Hot, super smart, nice.

Abby has helped me more than any other prof or TA during my time at SFU. She met with me many times to help me understand the assignments, gave detailed feedback to help me improve, and is all around pretty darn wonderful. Great with theory and writing. Very approachable. Fair grader. I wouldn't have survived this term without her.

Abby is AMAZING! I have never had a TA dedicate so much time to helping me. She truly cares about her students and wants us to learn, and she is willing meet with us and help us. You have to do the work to succeed, but if you do the work and ask for help she will give you amazing guidance and help you. We all love her! THE BEST! Would recommend!
Abby's good and nice; Interesting person to.
so helpful. always makes time to meet with students

You have to read the textbook. Lectures are just captured with additional examples, tutorials are pretty engaging. But watch out for midterms and finals, as the wording sometimes is different so you HAVE to know to material well enough, memorization will not be enough always. Overall, good lectures, nice workload, and caring prof,

Dawn is the best prof at SFU! There are not enough good things to say about Dawn, her class is very minimal work and she marks very easily. This was supposed to be a writing-heavy course but in my opinion, I did not have to write a lot at all. She is amazing and she is also super sweet! 10/10 would recommend taking her course!
